fast3d.util.math

Class MathUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • fast3d.util.math.MathUtil

  • public abstract class MathUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    giving functionality commonly used but not given by java.lang.Math
    Author:
    Tim Trense

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static float charToFloat(int number)
      extracts a floating-point-number from the lower (right) 2 bytes of the argument
      static double constrain(double value, double min, double max)
      if the value is within the interval [min,max] it will be returned with no difference
      if the value is lower than min, min is returned
      if the value is higher than max, max is returned
      static int floatToChar(float number)
      packs a float into the two lower (right) bytes of the result-int
      loss of accuracy!!!
      static double map(double value, double originMin, double originMax, double rangeMin, double rangeMax)
      the value within the interval of [originMin,originMax] will be at the same location relative to the new interval [rangeMin,rangeMax] as result example:
      map(value=20, originMin=0, originMax=40, intervalMin=0, intervalMin=20) will result in 10
      map(value=20, originMin=0, originMax=40, intervalMin=0, intervalMin=100) will result in 50
      map(value=3, originMin=3, originMax=4, intervalMin=0, intervalMin=100) will result in 0
      map(value=3, originMin=2, originMax=4, intervalMin=50, intervalMin=100) will result in 75
      static double overflow(double value, double min, double max)
      if the value is within the interval [min,max[ it remains the same
      otherwise if it will overflow upper and subtracted by max until it is in the interval
      otherwise if it will overflow lower and added by max until it is in the interval

    • Method Detail

      • map

        public static double map(double value,
                         double originMin,
                         double originMax,
                         double rangeMin,
                         double rangeMax)
        the value within the interval of [originMin,originMax] will be at the same location relative to the new interval [rangeMin,rangeMax] as result

        example:
        map(value=20, originMin=0, originMax=40, intervalMin=0, intervalMin=20) will result in 10
        map(value=20, originMin=0, originMax=40, intervalMin=0, intervalMin=100) will result in 50
        map(value=3, originMin=3, originMax=4, intervalMin=0, intervalMin=100) will result in 0
        map(value=3, originMin=2, originMax=4, intervalMin=50, intervalMin=100) will result in 75

        Parameters:
        value - the double to be mapped
        originMin - the lower border of the original interval
        originMax - the upper border of the original interval
        rangeMin - the lower border of the new interval
        rangeMax - the upper border of the new interval
        Returns:
        the mapped correspondent to the passed-in value

      • constrain

        public static double constrain(double value,
                               double min,
                               double max)
        if the value is within the interval [min,max] it will be returned with no difference
        if the value is lower than min, min is returned
        if the value is higher than max, max is returned
        Parameters:
        value - the value to be constrained
        min - the lower border of the interval
        max - the upper border of the interval
        Returns:
        the constrained value within the interval

      • overflow

        public static double overflow(double value,
                              double min,
                              double max)
        if the value is within the interval [min,max[ it remains the same
        otherwise if it will overflow upper and subtracted by max until it is in the interval
        otherwise if it will overflow lower and added by max until it is in the interval
        Parameters:
        value - the value to handle overflow
        min - the lower border of the interval
        max - the upper border of the interval
        Returns:
        the controlled value

      • floatToChar

        public static int floatToChar(float number)
        packs a float into the two lower (right) bytes of the result-int
        loss of accuracy!!!
        Parameters:
        number - the floating-point-number to pack into 2 bytes
        Returns:
        the 2 lower bytes of the result are the number
        See Also:
        charToFloat(int)

      • charToFloat

        public static float charToFloat(int number)
        extracts a floating-point-number from the lower (right) 2 bytes of the argument
        Parameters:
        number - the 2 lower bytes of the result are the number
        Returns:
        the extracted number
        See Also:
        floatToChar(float)
